newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Aeroflot opens regular Moscow-Tivat flights.
newsitem.headline: Aeroflot opens regular Moscow-Tivat flights.

text.p: Russia's Aeroflot has introduced a regular weekly flight from Moscow to Tivat on the Montenegrin coast, Belgrade newspapers reported on Tuesday.
The first 132-seater Tupolev 154 plane landed at Tivat airport on Monday.

The flight was introduced because Russian tourists are showing more and more interest in spending their holidays on the Adriatic coast of Montenegro, Belgrade daily Blic quoted Aeroflot Yugoslavia director Nikolai Jatsuny as saying.
If interest grows, besides the Monday flight, an additional one could be introduced on Fridays or a bigger Airbus plane engaged instead of the smaller Tupolevs, Jatsuny said.
